comments:
when the eclipseDir/workspace/cvsModuleName/.project file contains a CVS tag as
comment on the second line, I get first a window:

<<Problems during startup. Check the ".log" file in the ".metadata" directory of
your workspace.>>

Then I went to that file:
<<!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Apr 12, 2003 14:51:42.294
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:247)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Application not found:
org.eclipse.ui.workbench.
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:829)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
	... 7 more>>

Thx to bug http://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=32404 that I figured out
that the .project file was the cause.

Moving the line
<!-- $Id: .project,v 1.6 2003/04/12 14:24:41 hauser Exp $ -->
from line 2 to the end of .project solved the problem...

Conclusion:
It appears that xml comments are not properly treated? (or is there a rule that
no comments are allowed on line 2 of a file?)

P.S.: Did the same to .classpath (no complaint when xml comment on line 2)

This file is auto-generated, and we may overwrite it at any time and delete your
comment.  You shouldn't be adding extra things in there.

This bug occurs on Eclipse 2.0 only.  In Eclipse 2.1, the .project file parser
will tolerate and ignore comments.

I'm going to close since the bug is 2.0 only, and is not really a valid use case.

right, I got to 2.1 since and it no longer happens.

However, wouldn't it be good to label all the files that are auto-generated and
thus shouldn't be checked into CVS or alike with a corresponding warning comment?
